content:
The "long sentence" test exceed the limit "4<=message length<=100".

So I change the limit description and the stub.

I like the idea but I think that it is a little bit too long for a 5 minute clash.

- To make it shorter, I would suggest to remove the part with
ERROR, Nothing to decode and the removal of extra characters.
Else, you can decide to keep all the test cases but transform it into an easy community puzzle.

- In my opinion, it is not clear enough that the message has to be a square (except from the funny introduction). I would suggest to make it clearer.

- To make it completly clear, I would add an example of the square representation of the message (by instance, with CodinGame:

Cia
onm
dGe
Thank u very much for your opinion. I did a new version of it. How about that one?)
Oh yeah, I've missed it while was adding some new tests. Thank you.

Well, this time it is really more clear but I would say... a little bit too much :-)

For a clash of code format, you want to quickly read the statement and start as fast as possible.

It's why, one sentence for the context/the little joke might be enough. Then your example is good but should be more concise. 
In my opinion the example part should be reduced like this

---

Given a string , "CiaonmdGe" (9 characters), divide it in equals rows and columns (here 3 rows, 3 columns):
Cia
onm
dGe

And print the concatenation of all the columns, top  to down, left to right, in one line of text: "CodinGame"

----

And no more.
Firstly too short, secondly too much, so the third time I've chosen middle)
